kpi_info.title: period_duration (period_duration)
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_AVG_BUF_OCC (M1017C0)
kpi_info.use: The average RLC AM DL PDU transmission buffer occupancy. Includes both first-time transmission and retransmission buffers. Does not include periods when the DL transmission buffers in the RLC entity are empty. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released. Based on sampling, which is done every TTI (transmission time interval) when there is data in the DL transmission buffers of the RLC entity.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDCP_DL_AVG_BUF_OCC (M1017C1)
kpi_info.use: The average PDCP buffer occupancy in RLC AM DL. Does not include periods when the DL transmission buffers in the RLC entity are empty. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released. Based on sampling, which is done every TTI (transmission time interval) when there is data in the DL transmission buffers of the RLC entity.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_SUM_SQ_BUF_OCC (M1017C2)
kpi_info.use: The sum of squared RLC AM DL PDU transmission buffer occupancy values. Does not include periods when the DL transmission buffers in the RLC entity are empty. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDCP_SUM_SQ_BUF_OCC (M1017C3)
kpi_info.use: The sum of squared PDCP buffer occupancy values in RLC AM DL. Does not include periods when the DL transmission buffers in the RLC entity are empty. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_DL_BUFFER_REPORTS (M1017C4)
kpi_info.use: The number of RLC AM reports for the RLC AM DL transmission buffer and the PDCP buffer occupancy measurement. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_ERR_RATIO (M1017C5)
kpi_info.use: The ratio between unsuccessfully transmitted RLC AM DL PDUs and all transmitted RLC AM DL PDUs (including retransmissions). UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_TOTAL_TRANS (M1017C6)
kpi_info.use: The number of transmitted RLC AM DL PDUs. Includes also retransmitted DL PDUs and control PDUs. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_SQ_SUM_ERR (M1017C7)
kpi_info.use: The sum of squared RLC AM DL PDU error ratio values. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_ERR_REPORTS (M1017C8)
kpi_info.use: The number of RLC AM reports for the RLC AM DL PDU error ratio measurement. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_BAD_CONN (M1017C9)
kpi_info.use: The number of bad connections for RLC AM in downlink direction. UPDATED: When the object is changed/removed (e.g. the connection is released, or the RB is reconfigured) and if the ratio between the resent RLC PDUs and the total number of sent RLC PDUs (PDUtot) > x + y * sqrt( x*(1-x) / PDUtot ), where x = BLER-target and y = DLBLERConfInterval (RNW parameter).

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_TOO_GOOD_CONN (M1017C10)
kpi_info.use: The number of too good connections for RLC AM in downlink direction. UPDATED: When the object is changed/removed (e.g. the connection is released, or the RB is reconfigured) and if the ratio between the resent RLC PDUs and the total number of sent RLC PDUs (PDUtot) < x - y * sqrt( x*(1-x) / PDUtot ), where x = BLER-target and y = DLBLERConfInterval (RNW parameter).

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_IDEAL_CONN (M1017C11)
kpi_info.use: The number of ideal connections for RLC AM in downlink direction. UPDATED:When the object is changed/removed (e.g. the connection is released, or the RB is reconfigured) and neither of the equations presented in counters M1017C9 and M1017C10 is true.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_GR_TP (M1017C12)
kpi_info.use: The average downlink PDU gross throughput of the RLC AM connection. Includes also retransmissions. Does not include periods when the DL transmission buffers in the RLC entity are empty. The throughput calculation is done so that the used downlink active data transmission time is observed with 240 millisecond sampling periods, and if during such sampling period the sent downlink data volume exceeds 3000 bytes, the entire 240 ms period is summed to the total transfer time counter. This 240 ms value is used even if actually the RLC buffer would not have contained data all the time during the entire sampling interval. If the transferred data volume is smaller than 3000 bytes, the transfer time counter is incremented by the actual time that there was data in the DL RLC buffer. Here the resolution is 10 ms. The sampling period falls into this category typically for example during small keepalive packet sending caused by smartphones. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_GR_TP_SQ_SUM (M1017C13)
kpi_info.use: The sum of squared RLC AM DL PDU gross throughput values. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_TP_REPORTS (M1017C14)
kpi_info.use: The number of RLC AM reports for RLC AM DL gross and net throughput values. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_NET_TP (M1017C15)
kpi_info.use: The average downlink net PDU throughput of RLC AM connections. Does not include retransmissions. Does not include periods when the DL transmission buffers in the RLC entity are empty. The throughput calculation is done so that the used downlink active data transmission time is observed with 240 millisecond sampling periods, and if during such sampling period the sent downlink data volume exceeds 3000 bytes, the entire 240 ms period is summed to the total transfer time counter. This 240 ms value is used even if actually the RLC buffer would not have contained data all the time during the entire sampling interval. If the transferred data volume is smaller than 3000 bytes, the transfer time counter is incremented by the actual time that there was data in the DL RLC buffer. Here the resolution is 10 ms. The sampling period falls into this category typically for example during small keepalive packet sending caused by smartphones. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_NET_TP_SQ_SUM (M1017C16)
kpi_info.use: The sum of squared RLC AM DL PDU net throughput values. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_SQ_SUM_TR_TIME (M1017C17)
kpi_info.use: The sum of squared transmission time values for the RLC AM downlink. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_AVG_TRANS (M1017C18)
kpi_info.use: The average number of required transmissions per PDU in RLC AM DL. For a perfect connection the value of this counter is one. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_DISCARD_RATIO (M1017C19)
kpi_info.use: The RLC PDU discard ratio for downlink connections using RLC AM. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_SQ_SUM_TRANS (M1017C20)
kpi_info.use: The sum of squared average number of transmissions per PDU values in RLC AM DL. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_DL_FOR_TRANS (M1017C21)
kpi_info.use: The number of downlink RLC AM PDUs added to the RLC transmission buffer. This includes also PDUs retransmitted due to RLC polling procedure. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_SDU_DL_ERROR_RATIO (M1017C22)
kpi_info.use: The average SDU error ratio in RLC AM downlink. Defined as the ratio between discarded SDUs and the total number of SDUs received for transmission from the PDCP layer. Note that this counter does not include RLC SDUs that have overflowed from the PDCP buffer. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_SDU_DL_SQ_SUM_ERR_R (M1017C23)
kpi_info.use: The sum of squared SDU error ratio values in RLC AM DL. Measured from the RLC entity. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_SDU_DL_AVG_TR_DELAY (M1017C24)
kpi_info.use: The average transfer delay of transferred RLC AM SDUs in downlink. Transfer delay is the time difference between when the SDU is received from the upper layer (RRC or PDCP) and when the last PDU containing data from that SDU is acknowledged by the UE as successfully transferred. If an SDU is discarded due to SDU discard function, the transfer time is then the difference between the time when SDU is received from the upper layer and the time when SDU is discarded. UPDATED:Measured continuously from radio bearers and updated to a counter when the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_SDU_DL_SUM_TR_DELAY (M1017C25)
kpi_info.use: The sum of average SDU transfer delay values in RLC AM DL. UPDATED:Measured continuously from radio bearers and updated to a counter when the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_SDU_SUM_TR_DEL_STADEV (M1017C26)
kpi_info.use: The sum of standard deviations of the SDU transfer delay values in RLC AM DL. UPDATED:Measured continuously from radio bearers and updated to a counter when the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_SDU_DL_SUM_SQ_TR_DEL (M1017C27)
kpi_info.use: The sum of squared SDU transmission delay values in RLC AM DL. UPDATED:Measured continuously from radio bearers and updated to a counter when the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_SDU_DL_SDUS_FOR_TRANS (M1017C28)
kpi_info.use: The number of RLC AM SDUs ready for transmission in downlink. Includes also discarded SDUs. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released, this counter is updated by the number of handled DL SDUs.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_DL_MEAS_TIME (M1017C29)
kpi_info.use: The total time period when the measurement was active in the RLC AM DL entity. The active time is the time between when the first RLC SDU arrives in the RLC buffer and when all the RLC PDUs of the packet call have been acknowledged. Periods when the DL transmission buffers are empty are excluded. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_SDU_UL_PS_VOL (M1017C30)
kpi_info.use: The number of SDU bytes transmitted in uplink using RLC AM. The RLC SDU payload measuring is made for compressed bytes (before PDCP in UL) and includes RLC SDU headers. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_SDU_DL_PS_VOL (M1017C31)
kpi_info.use: The number of SDU bytes transmitted in downlink using RLC AM. The RLC SDU payload measuring is made for compressed bytes (after PDCP in DL) and includes RLC SDU headers. Discarded SDUs are included. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_PDU_UL_FOR_TRANS (M1017C32)
kpi_info.use: The number of received RLC AM PDUs in uplink. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_AM_UL_MEAS_TIME (M1017C33)
kpi_info.use: The total time period when the measurement was active in the RLC AM UL entity. The active time is the time between when the first RLC SDU arrives in the RLC buffer and when all the RLC PDUs of the packet call have been acknowledged. Periods when the transmission buffers are empty are excluded. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_1 (M1017C34)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with 0...4 kbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameter RCPMtputDLCl01to02Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_2 (M1017C35)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with 4...8 kbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl01to02Range and RCPMtputDLCl02to03Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_3 (M1017C36)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with 8...16 kbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl02to03Range and RCPMtputDLCl03to04Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one. The number of connections with 8...16 kbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl02to03Range and RCPMtputDLCl03to04Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

kpi_info.use: The number of connections with 32...64 kbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl04to05Range and RCPMtputDLCl05to06Range. kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_6 (M1017C39)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with 64...128 kbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl05to06Range and RCPMtputDLCl06to07Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. kpi_info.use: The number of connections with 128...256 kbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl06to07Range and RCPMtputDLCl07to08Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_8 (M1017C41)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with 256...512 kbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl07to08Range and RCPMtputDLCl08to09Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_9 (M1017C42)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with 512 kbit/s...1 Mbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl08to09Range and RCPMtputDLCl09to10Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_10 (M1017C43)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with 1 Mbit/s...2 Mbit/s downlink gross RLC PDU throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl09to10Range and RCPMtputDLCl10to11Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

kpi_info.title: RLC_RETRANS_DISTR_CLASS_0 (M1017C44)
kpi_info.use: The number of downlink RLC AM PDUs which have been successfully delivered to the UE without retransmissions. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_RETRANS_DISTR_CLASS_1 (M1017C45)
kpi_info.use: The number of downlink RLC AM PDUs which have been successfully delivered to the UE with one retransmission. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_RETRANS_DISTR_CLASS_2 (M1017C46)
kpi_info.use: The number of downlink RLC AM PDUs which have been successfully delivered to the UE with two retransmissions. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_RETRANS_DISTR_CLASS_3 (M1017C47)
kpi_info.use: The number of downlink RLC AM PDUs which have been successfully delivered to the UE with three retransmissions. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_RETRANS_DISTR_CLASS_4 (M1017C48)
kpi_info.use: The number of downlink RLC AM PDUs which have been successfully delivered to the UE with four retransmissions. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: RLC_RETRANS_DISTR_CLASS_5 (M1017C49)
kpi_info.use: The number of downlink RLC AM PDUs which have been successfully delivered to the UE with five or more retransmissions or the PDU is discarded. UPDATED:When the RLC AM connection is modified or released.

kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_11 (M1017C50)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with the 2 Mbit/s...4 Mbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl10to11Range and RCPMtputDLCl11to12Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput in the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_12 (M1017C51)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with the 4 Mbit/s...8 Mbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputDLCl11to12Range and RCPMtputDLCl12to13Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. UPDATED:When a connection is cleared, the AM RLC entity reports the throughput measurement values to the L3 entity. Then the corresponding class of the throughput distribution is incremented by one.

kpi_info.title: USER_DL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_13 (M1017C52)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with larger than the 8 Mbit/s downlink RLC PDU gross throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameter RCPMtputDLCl12to13Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. kpi_info.title: USER_UL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_1 (M1017C53)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with the 0 kbit/s...250 kbit/s uplink SDU throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameter RCPMtputULCl01to02Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. kpi_info.title: USER_UL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_2 (M1017C54)

kpi_info.title: USER_UL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_3 (M1017C55)

kpi_info.title: USER_UL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_4 (M1017C56)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with the 1000 kbit/s...1500 kbit/s uplink SDU throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameters RCPMtputULCl03to04Range and RCPMtputULCl04to05Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions. kpi_info.title: USER_UL_THRP_DIST_CLASS_5 (M1017C57)
kpi_info.use: The number of connections with larger than the 1500 kbit/s uplink SDU throughput. The range can be adjusted by parameter RCPMtputULCl04to05Range. The unit of counter can be changed to "1000 bytes" by setting the RNC parameter RCPMtputAggregationLevel to a value of 1, then the counter shows the amount of data volume (with throughput within the specified range) that is transferred, instead of updating the counter by the number of transfer sessions.
